title: AI Assistant for Clinical History Quality
description: This project is dedicated to developing advanced AI-driven tools to support physicians during the clinical note-taking process. It is not intended to replace existing Electronic Health Record (EHR) systems, which remain the authoritative platforms for storing and managing clinical histories. Instead, our focus is on making the documentation process simpler, more comprehensive, and seamlessly coordinated with prior patient information. Key objectives include enabling real-time quality assessment of clinical notes against standard templates (such as SOAP or APSO) and custom configurations, as well as evaluating new entries for anomalies or inconsistencies when compared to the patient's historical record. To achieve these goals, our technical strategy addresses the challenges of unstructured healthcare data by employing Large Language Models (LLMs), semantic search, and graph databases. This approach creates a dynamic knowledge layer over patient data, mapping complex clinical relationships to ensure interoperability for enhanced diagnostic support and clinical research, all while adhering to strict data privacy and compliance standards. Our working group has made progress using models like MedGemma 27B to evaluate advanced clinical reasoning for improving clinical notes. Furthermore, we are assessing the performance of open-weight models on Spanish-language medical notes and applying Context Engineering techniques, such as variations of AutoMedPrompt, to improve note analysis.

title: AI Governance Tools
description: [En español] Creación de herramientas de gobernanza para la IA: Utilizamos plataformas de IA para apoyar la investigación y recolección de material para definir un documento base para la creación de un marco de gobernanza para la IA, la gestión de riesgos y el cumplimiento normativo de iniciativas de Inteligencia Artificial. El objetivo de nuestro Grupo de Gobierno es establecer un conjunto de herramientas que ayuden a las organizaciones a definir una conversación -que esperamos que integre a múltiples actores- que conduzca a la definición de directrices y que faciliten a las organizaciones implementar prácticas responsables y éticas en el uso de la inteligencia artificial.

title: AI assisted tool to Learning and Training for Medical Professionals
description: This initiative constitutes a formal investigation into the pedagogical applications of generative AI within medical education. The project will evaluate the efficacy of an AI-assisted adaptive learning platform designed to enhance the training of medical professionals. By leveraging specialized LLMs such as MedGemma, the system will generate personalized learning trajectories and provide real-time, context-aware feedback. The research will critically assess how cutting-edge AI models that process medical text and imagery can be used to create immersive and effective training modules, with a foundational analysis of the ethical considerations inherent in AI-mediated professional development [1].

title: Onboarding of Employee and Reskilling
description: This research initiative is dedicated to mitigating knowledge deficits and accelerating the organizational assimilation of new personnel within medium to large enterprises. The project evaluates the efficacy of LLM-powered adaptive tutoring systems in creating personalized and efficient onboarding and reskilling pathways. A central focus is the development and validation of sophisticated prompt engineering strategies and AI-driven pedagogical frameworks to optimize knowledge transfer. The study also incorporates a critical examination of the ethical implications surrounding AI-mediated employee training and performance analytics [1].

title: AI Workshop for Health Professionals
description: This workshop is architected for clinical leaders and health professionals poised to actively shape the next generation of AI-driven healthcare solutions. Participants will transcend the role of end-user to become integral co-designers of intelligent systems for diagnostics, professional training, and patient wellness. The workshop provides a comprehensive grounding in the operational principles of medical AI, including specialized LLMs and generative models, while focusing on practical application design and integration into clinical workflows. Key modules will cover the development of robust frameworks for data privacy, medico-legal compliance, and the ethical imperatives of deploying AI in patient care. The goal is to empower medical experts to use AI tools and to collaborate effectively with technical teams to conceptualize and validate AI assistants that address tangible clinical challenges.

title: Software Developer Onboarding
description: This project involves a systematic survey and development of an AI-augmented ecosystem designed to accelerate the onboarding process for software developers in organizations undergoing digital transformation. The research is centered on architecting intelligent AI agents, manifested as IDE extensions (e.g., for VSCode), which utilize Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) to parse proprietary codebases and GIT repositories. The objective is to deliver a system that provides real-time, contextual support, thereby significantly reducing the ramp-up period and enhancing developer efficacy and integration [1].

title: AI for Unstructured Business Data
description: This initiative is focused on architecting an intelligent knowledge management framework to extract actionable insights from heterogeneous, unstructured corporate data sources such as reports, emails, and contracts. By synthesizing Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), vector databases, and knowledge graphs, the project aims to construct a sophisticated semantic search and data analysis layer. A pivotal goal is the seamless integration of this structured intelligence into enterprise systems like Business Process Management Systems (BPMS) and Headless CMS, thereby transforming inert data archives into dynamic assets that drive process automation and strategic decision-making [1].

title: Mini-pilot AI Tools for Senior Support
description: This concluded pilot project encompassed the design, implementation, and empirical assessment of an assistive AI technology tailored for older adults. The research objective was to evaluate the effectiveness of user-centric AI in augmenting the autonomy of seniors in daily activities. The solution employed multimodal interfaces, specifically leveraging voice-driven AI and video capture analysis powered by the Gemini LLM. Foundational to its design was a rigorous application of accessibility engineering principles to ensure high usability and foster adoption within the target demographic, aligning with the lab's mission of creating socially impactful technology [1].

title: AI Tools for Senior Support
description: Building upon the empirical findings from the initial mini-pilot, this project will architect a second-generation AI companion for senior care. This planning phase is focused on the conceptual design of a more sophisticated, proactive system utilizing autonomous AI agents and advanced LLMs. The research will investigate methodologies for delivering personalized, context-aware support that extends beyond simple task execution to include cognitive engagement and wellness monitoring. The ultimate aim is to address complex challenges in elder care through a scalable, ethically-grounded technological solution [1].

title: AI Workshop for Teachers and Educators
description: This workshop is designed for pioneering educators who wish to transition from being users of AI to creators of bespoke AI-driven pedagogical tools. Participants will engage in a rigorous exploration of the theoretical underpinnings and practical design of various AI classroom archetypes, including  AI-tutors, AI-coachs, AI-mentors, AI-teammates, AI-tools, AI-simulators, and AI-students. The workshop moves beyond basic AI interaction to focus on the entire co-creation lifecycle: from identifying pedagogical needs to use, designing, prototyping, and deploying intelligent systems that foster critical thinking and personalized learning. We will critically analyze the affordances, risks, and ethical frameworks required to deploy AI solutions tailored to specific school and student contexts.
